item.description:
I just noticed that the Summer Concert Series is back at Veterans Park!  Please join me for some excellent music and fantastic company.  Afterward we can go somewhere to have a drink.

http://www.intownmanchester.com/images/Portrait%20of%20Headliners.jpg

About the Band:

Vaud and the Villians is a 19 piece 1930's New Orleans orchestra and cabaret show.  With echoes of Bruce Springsteen's Seeger Session Band, they mine the rich soil of the American songbook - roots, trad jazz, revival music, parlour music, gospel, zydeco, folk ... but they are more than a genre bending musical/concert haymaker punch.  It is at once seedy and inspiring .. gritty and sublime.

http://www.vaudandthevillains.com/

Cost: FREE!

DIRECTIONS TO VETERANS PARK From the South:

Take the Everett Turnpike or Route 93N to Route 293N. Take Exit 5 (Granite Street). Turn right at bottom of the ramp, cross the bridge and proceed straight through two lights. Look for the Center of NH Parking Garage on your left. Veterans Park will be diagonally across to the left. From the North: Take Route 93S to Route 293S. Take Exit 6 (Amoskeag Bridge). Bear right off of the exit and turn right after the Ramada Inn. Cross the bridge and bear right onto Canal Street. Go through several sets of lights to Granite Street and turn left onto Granite Street. Look for the Center of NH Parking Garage on your left. Veterans Park will be diagonally across to the left. From the East: Take 101 West to 93 South. At the split, follow signs for 293 North. Follow 293 North to Exit 5 (Granite Street). Turn right at the bottom of the ramp, cross the bridge and proceed straight through two lights. Look for the Center of NH Parking Garage on your left. Veterans Park will be diagonally across to the left.
item.how_to_find_us: I will have a balloon attached to my chair.
item.name: TD Bank Summer Concert Series: Vaud and the Villians
